An unprecedented look at the c 0:40 Gary Beadle is back on MTV in new show Spring Bre 1:00 This Morning: Sharon Marshall finally meets Micha 0:44 Loose Women: Coleen Nolan reveals dramatic hospit 0:58 Loose Women: Coleen Nolan explains why Celebrity 1:02 Video will play in  Sheridan Smith stars in Shannon Matthews' kidnapping drama Share this video Watch Next   Share   Comments Get celebs   Sheridan Smith is back on our TV screens tonight in the new BBC drama retelling the search for Shannon Matthews .
The Moorside is a dramatic retelling of what happened when the youngster ‘disappeared’ in 2008 - only for it to be found out her mum Karen Matthews was behind it all.
Sheridan will be playing Karen’s friend Julie Bushby - who stood by her throughout the trial.
What's the real story behind The Moorside? (Photo: BBC) But what was the real story behind The Moorside? Shannon Matthews was reported missing on the afternoon of 19 February 2008 in Dewsbury, West Yorkshire, England when she was aged nine years old.
Led by Detective Superintendent Andy Brennan, the search for her became a major missing person police operation and was even compared to the disappearance of Madeleine McCann.
The West Yorkshire Police questioned 1,500 motorists and searched 3,000 houses.
By 5 March, more than 250 officers and 60 detectives were involved in the investigation, about 10% of the West Yorkshire force's operational strength.
Read More Who are Karen Matthews and Julie Bushby? Real-life characters in pictures Shannon Matthews was reported as missing in 2008 (Photo: West Yorkshire Police/PA) Karen Matthews campaigned for her "missing" daughter (Photo: Daily Mirror) Friends and neighbours at the Community Centre helping in the search for missing schoolgirl (Photo: Phil Spencer) It became the largest police search for a missing person since the Yorkshire Ripper investigation 30 years previously.
She was found on 14 March 2008 at a house in Batley Carr, a short distance from Dewsbury - which belonged to 39-year-old Michael Donovan, the uncle of Shannon’s mother Karen’s boyfriend Craig Meehan.
The kidnapping was subsequently discovered to have been planned by Karen and Michael to generate money from the publicity.
Their plan was for Michael to have eventually ‘found’ Shannon, take her to a police station and claim the reward money, which would be split between him and Karen
.
Karen Matthews with Craig Meehan campaigned to find Shannon (Photo: REUTERS/Nigel Roddis) Michael Donovan was arrested straight away (Photo: West Yorkshire Police/PA) Karen was eventually arrested and jailed (Photo: Daily Mirror) When Shannon was found, Michael was arrested at the scene and charged with kidnapping and false imprisonment.
Karen Matthews was charged with child neglect and perverting the course of justice on 8 April 2008.
The joint trial of Donovan and Karen Matthews at Leeds Crown Court commenced on 11 November 2008 and concluded on 4 December with both defendants found guilty of kidnapping, false imprisonment, and perverting the course of justice.
They were both given eight-year prison sentences and Karen's boyfriend Craig was convicted of possessing child pornography which was discovered on his computer during the investigation - although it had nothing to do with the kidnapping.
Karen was released from prison April 2012 after serving half her sentence., while Donovan had already been released.
Karen has been released from prison since (Photo: Phil Spencer) She was given a new name for use in public, although authorities did not consider her mentally capable of maintaining a completely new identity and she will retain her real name for engagement with officials.
Meanwhile, Shannon was placed under police protection and cared for by the social services.
She ceased to be subject to police protection on 17 March 2008, and, since then, she has remained in the care of Kirklees Family Services on a voluntary basis.
On 15 March the police reported that Shannon Matthews had begun to recover after her ordeal, with specially-trained officers questioning her to establish what had happened.
*The Moorside starts on BBC One on Tuesday 7th February at 9pm
